TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi DriveListBox extends System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")

Docs.summary: Enables a user to select a valid disk drive at run time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this control to display a list of all the valid drives in a user's system. You can create dialog boxes that enable the user to open a file from a list of files on a disk in any available drive.
If you also display the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DirListBox> and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox> controls, you can write code to synchronize them with the `DriveListBox` control and with each other.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A `DriveListBox` control enables a user to select a valid disk drive at run time.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data source for a .
Docs.value: An object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IList> or interfaces, such as a or a <xref:System.Array>. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property should not be set for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control; it is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the property to display for this .
Docs.value: A that represents the name of an object property and is contained in the collection specified by the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox.DataSource%2A> property. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property should not be set for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control; it is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by a control and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the disposing parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with the disposing parameter set to `false`.
When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this control references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.value: One of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.DrawMode%2A> values that represent the mode for drawing the items of the control. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property should not be set for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control; it is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the selected drive at run time.
Docs.value: A expression that specifies the selected drive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The valid drives for the `Drive` property include all drives present in or connected to the system when the control is created or refreshed at run time. The default setting of the `Drive` property is the current drive.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the style of a combo box.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `DropDownStyle` property controls the interface that is presented to the user. You can enter a value that provides a simple drop-down list box, where the list always appears, a drop-down list box, where the text portion is not editable and you must select an arrow to view the drop-down, or the default drop-down list box, where the text portion is editable and the user must press the arrow key to view the list. To always display a list that the user cannot edit, use a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> control.
If you set the `DropDownStyle` property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxStyle>, you can select only valid values from the list. If you set the `DropDownStyle` property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxStyle>, you can type any value in the editable area of the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox>.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets the height of an item in the .
Docs.value: The height, in pixels, of an item in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is not required for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control; the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> does not support items of variable height. It is provided only because the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox> control inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets the items that are contained in a .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox.ObjectCollection> that represents the items in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to retrieve a list of drives that are currently displayed in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox>.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.param: The number of a specific item in the list.
Docs.summary: Gets the item for a specified index in a .
Docs.value: A that contains the name of the drive at the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to retrieve the name of a drive in a <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox>.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum length of text displayed in a .
Docs.value: An that specifies the maximum length for the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.DriveListBox.Drive%2A> property.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnBackColorChanged(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The `OnBackColorChanged` method also enables derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the items in a is sorted alphabetically.
Docs.value: if items in the control are sorted; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. Docs.summary: Gets the text displayed in a .
Docs.value: A that contains the text that is displayed.

remarks.format:

> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. MemberSignature.Value: protected override void WndProc (ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void WndProc(valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Message m) cil managed

Docs.summary: Processes Windows messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All messages are sent to the `WndProc` method after being filtered through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.PreProcessMessage%2A> method.
The `WndProc` method corresponds exactly to the Windows `WindowProc` function. For more information about processing Windows messages, see the `WindowProc` function documentation in the Windows Platform SDK reference located on the [MSDN Library](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=98124) Web site.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
